reviews.text: Es un lugar histórico cuyo museo hace retroceder a la época colonial. Agradable para los sancarlistas.

The Convento de Santa Clara is a large and interesting convent to explore with beautiful gardens, a gorgeous courtyard, and detailed colonial architecture. It was great for photography! 

Inside the tall walls surrounding this convent, I discovered such beautiful and intricate colonial architecture, a pretty water fountain in the centre of an amazing courtyard, expansive rooms and gorgeous manicured gardens. The courtyard was surrounded by buildings with beautiful arches. There were lots of pathways, hallways and interesting hidden areas to explore and it was a really beautiful place to wander around. 

The views of the courtyard and volcano landscape were amazing after climbing the stairs to the top of the ruins. 

This convent was a fascinating place to explore and take photos and the atmosphere was so peaceful and relaxed. The entrance fee was Q40. This convent is definitely worth a visit when in Antigua! Review based on my experience visiting in November 2016.
Nice colonial style convent
Nice 👍
Really worth the time to stop by here and get a feel for the scale of this convent.
I guess this is the most beautiful convent in this city. Very peaceful and "señorial"

La Recoleccion is an interesting and lesser-visited ruins site to explore, located on the outskirts of Antigua, near the local market, with amazing photo opportunities. 

Very little of this former church remains standing and it is almost completely in ruins, due to severe destruction from earthquakes that shook Antigua in the late 1700's. Aside from the stone staircase at the front of the church, the crumbling tall stone walls are the only part of the church which is still intact and standing. Grasses and plants were growing through cracks in the stones. The grounds were beautifully maintained and there was a manicured grassy area with some large shade trees in front of the church, where locals were relaxing and having picnics. Once you walk up the stairs to enter the church, you will see massive chunks of stone and rubble laying everywhere inside the walls. There were lots of locals there during my Sunday afternoon visit and children were running around and playing hide and seek among the ruins and I encountered some local couples kissing and love-making in some of the nooks and crannies of the ruins. Nothing has been to restore this structure and it has probably looked the same since it was destroyed. It was mind-blowing for me to imagine an earthquake so big that it would cause this level of destruction to such a large church and it was really a testament to the incredible power that nature has over humans. But this former church was so beautiful in its crumbling state. 

I loved exploring the ruins and grounds of this church and climbing around on the large stones. The atmosphere was calm and peaceful. It was a great place to just walk around and the photo opportunities of this structure were amazing. These were definitely one of the most fascinating and impressive church ruins that I visited in Antigua.

Apparently there is a Q40 entrance fee, however nobody was manning the ticket booth during my visit so I just walked in and was able to enjoy these beautiful ruins for free. 

La Recoleccion is definitely worth a visit in Antigua! Don't miss this one.

Of all the church ruins in Antigua, this is my favorite. Like San Jeronimo, the grounds surrounding the structure are a park. But inside the structure, it is not! The main church building remains in a perpetual state of collapsed rubble since its destruction in the 1773 earthquake that ended Antigua as the capital of Mesoamerica. Standing on the rubble you sense the sheer size of the original building. All that was above you is now below you in a haphazard jumble. Going through the rest of the adjoining building seems to be on level ground. But if you look at how low the arches and doorways are, you realize that you are on leveled out rubble with grass on it.
Quite a stunning place. We really loved walking through it and reading about the history. Be sure to save your tickets, since you can reuse them at about 5 other sites.
Stunning place to go for a walk throw the old ruins loots of history
There is no guide but the pkace is really nice.

The "tour" was excellent! I loved making my own chocolate. I thought it would be too touristy, but it was actually fun. Best part is making (and eating) your chocolate with the different flavorings. If you do the tour, you get 10% off your store purchase too.
It was a very nice experience! We didn't have a lot of knowledge about chocolate and now we know  much more. Shout out to Raul, he was amazing!

I'm a big chocolate fan. This is the best place to go for me. We could get everything in chocolate flavour. From Liqueur, bathroom products to even chocolate flavoured tea. The food is also delicious. There is a chocolate making course available. My wife and I went a couple of times.

This place was amazing! Great chocolate tea and brownie combo that I got! The place has very great merchandise and all is at a very great price! 10/10 would recommend for any locals, tourists and visitors
I love chocolate so i enjoyed their chocolate drink and sweets. Their meal was also great
Delicious food and amazing view!
Muy interesante conocer el trabajo que lleva una pieza típica, ahora entiendo por qué su precio...
Una experiencia muy interesante. Aprendemos de nuestra cultura y personas muy amables quienes atienden
Es muy hermoso y tiene muchas cosas artesanales como trajes típicos de Guatemala entre otros
Excelente atención para los visitantes del museo
Lovely park and people very historical buildings
Great place to hang out with the family. Gets crowded in the evenings.

On a busy, sunny afternoon you encounter a people watching extravaganza. The large park with wide walks, shade trees, and fountains bustle with rural folk peddling their crafts, tourists from around the world, soap box speakers competing for an audience, travelers waiting to exchange currency, police scurrying about, musicians playing loudly over the din, and those just taking a break.
Very pretty night time visit, lots of great quirky bars and restaurants. Live music too! Beautiful area. Can be a bit pricey
Wonderful place to be

Extremely impressed with the climb up so you better be in shape. It's not for the faint of heart as it is high up but the view I spectacular. You see the city in all its glory and the fact that the indigenous people over 500 years ago ran up this spot to avoid certain death after the volcano de agua blew is amazing. This is a trek believe me, bit well worth it.

Rewarding climb, beautiful view. There are some benches and tables to stop at on the way up, police were hanging around so it was very safe. Definitely worth doing while in Antigua. Free if you walk up.

Epic adventure in Antigua. Reasonable walk up the mountain and easy walk down to the city. Go in the morning for the clearest view of Agua and good lighting on the city. There are snacks and water for sale once you get up there.

One of the best views in Antigua (see Volcán Agua from here), accessible by foot or car, with a few street vendors selling snacks, water, and small souvenirs. It takes about ten minutes to walk up from the entrance, walking at a moderate pace up the dirt path with many stairs. The walk is mostly shaded but still hot at midday, so try to go when it's not too hot for a more enjoyable time.
Wonderful view. Recommend on going close to sunset or at the early morning because it hot there and it nice to just chill and relax
My beautiful country Guatemala..!!

Nice looking volcano! I know you can climb this too. But we didn’t do it. You can pretty much take awesome photos with this volcano in the background from every street in Antigua. This actively exploding volcano. That one is just to it’s NW.
Wow! What a sight! Agua Volcan is impressively large and beautiful!

When we first touched down at the International Airport in Guatemala City in November 1975  all I could see out of my window was the beautiful Volcan de Agua. My first words were, "Is THAT a volcano?"
A beautiful spanish antique area. November was a perfect weather. Many local shops and jade shops. Must visit
Best bagels in all of Antigua (and a 2-for-1 special you cant beat!) and just had their muy rico veggie wrap.  YUM!!!
Awesome 2*1 mcbarn bagel offer
It ain't a NY bagel but for Guatemala it hit the spot. I was really craving something other than local fare for breakfast  and this place was it. It was clean & cozy. Even the bathroom.

The bagels aren't quite NY style and it's pricey. 

Like that they offer movies nightly. Would be nice to have movie schedule announced farther in advance and to close the door (to reduce noise) during the showing.
I liked the bagel, I had the inglés. They have different bagel options (wholewheat, sesame etc) and I would‘ve just wished they asked for our choice when we ordered.

Beautiful spot to eat and the best Croissants I've had in a long time; bought a couple to go.    My breakfast was very good, Eggs & bacon with a fruit plate.  The patio is beautiful, great ambiance, excellent service and reasonably priced for what you get.

Absolutely delicious!  My husband & I each had a savory crepe for dinner, but they were so big that we wished we'd have split one so we'd have had room for dessert.  (Nice to have leftovers for breakfast, though.)  We will definitely be back!

This remains our favorite night spot with our friends when we come down here. It's busy, but festive. There is nothing quite like having a good time with friends on their terrace in the moonlight. The crepes are to die for. And they also have superb smoothies.
Place is not bad but the food made me sick!!! Maybe the crepes are good but I had a salad and I ended up in the emergency.
Great place to have a good time with family and friends at a dinner or at lunch.
Great menu and chill place to work if you have to

One of my favorite restaurants/bars in Antigua. They are constantly improving everything with live music Friday and Sunday nights. The staff is friendly and the food is great. My favorites are veggie, chicken, steak sandwiches, carbonara, lasagna, double cheeseburger and fries.
Great food. Great staff
Best lasgane ive had while travelling! Staff are great aswell
Good food (not the best) and friendly staff, but they took too long to bring the food.
This is the best ice cream in town with some really interesting and tasty flavours. The “5X Chocolate” is phenomenal!!
The mango basil ice cream was really good. What i like is that they have over 20 flavors to choose from, but I wish they would have the option to get a scoop of each flavor,  not just one.
Tasty ice cream! Small shop located close to the Parque Central. As of Jan 2018 the ice creams were 20Q. Creamy and unusual flavours, worth a visit!
Kind of expensive

It was delicious!, the mix of flavors are really exotic but superb. I recommend asking for ice creams that have been refrigerated for more than 6-8 hours or it can be too soft, too creamy (this is my one and only complaint)
A beautiful view! All was incredibly well!
A bit pricey for the experience and it was full of very loud people, locals and tourists alike.
Calidad
Excelente vista de la ciudad!!!

Love the food, people, music, decor! Great food from very affordable & tasty up to delicious & creative. Top 5 places to eat & closest to buses & marcad on west side. Wish I lived there, but annual visits bring me back to La Peña.
Caution - In mid 2013 there was a change in management. Nasty spat between the business partners resulting in the gringo partners being forced out. Be very careful.
Good food. The current owners are American and are quite friendly.
Comida buena, ambiente agradable.
Ya no existe, aca funciona hoy dia Enero 2017 Miso, restaurant de comida Coreana muy buena!!!!

Pretty good cocktails. Menu changes often so don’t get attached. They used to make a really good robalo dish that we came back the next night for. They changed it to a really fatty butter sauce and instead of telling me they didn’t have the salad it came with anymore they just threw fries on it. Ask me a few months ago I’d give 4 stars but now it’s a 3 star restaurant.
Went here for a quick cocktail on way to dinner. Place looked to be nice enough although a not dark. Cocktail could have been a bit better. Seems worth a visit though
Delicious food, amazing staff. Such a cute place
High quality resturant, excellent food, special atmosphere
Wonderful service and fantastic food. Proper French bistro fare!
Good service. Tasty meat. A bit undercooked though. Recommended.

Had a great steak dinner with very good service, wine and food.  I highly recommend the queso asado as a starter and try sitting in one of the tables in the front with a view to the church across the street, so romantic!

Great Steak House such a beautiful place to have lunch. I had a great time, the food was delicious it was FDA approved, the service was excellent, the waiters were after you and all you needed. The only thing that I didn't like was that the drinks are expensive and the large is really small is like 18 Oz for about 30 quetzales I had an orange juice and soda and The Taste was good but it was not worth that much money for the rest of the food it was great it was amazing it was an amazing flavor totally recommended if you are a Steakhouse foodie

If you want a good steak I'm Guatemala and decent table service this is the place to go in Antigua ... Yes it's a bit pricey but the food is good and the meats are cooked to order... Finding a good steak in Antigua is a bit hard but if you don't mind paying premium for your dinner or lunch this is a great place to visit ... We had a platter with 4 different meats appetizer, 2 drinks and dessert for about $100 u.s. for Guate standard this is expensive..tourist and foreigners may be good deal .... The service even the hostess is really good always trying to up sell you but stick with what you like
Wonderful dinner. We had the Mixed Grill - by far the best steak we have eaten on this trip! Highly recommend for great service and excellent food.
